To get it to not slow down your PC too much you're going to sacrifice voice quality.  First off to make the voice sound more realistic you're probably going to want to move sound threshold in the sound settings under preferences somewhere around the middle.  Turn sound quality to high for best voice but most CPU usage and put voice pickup fairly high for a realistic voice like 2 notches over from the furthest, cancel background noise for sure to get rid of the electronic hum from the background.  

Thanks for all the props everyone.  Post requests to other software and I'll see if i can't whip up a little patch or crack ^^.
